Dear Ms. Prudhomme:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
6/9/21. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It should be
noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of the MISEP
and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter
and must include the following:
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular license will be issued. If
you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action will result.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.4139 Driver's License
The institution shall document that the driver of any vehicle
transporting residents at the request of or on behalf of the
licensee shall be an adult and possess a valid operator or
chauffeur license with endorsement appropriate to the
vehicle driven and the circumstances of its use.
Two of six employee files held an expired driver’s license. One license expired in
2019, the other expired 6/9/2021. No documentation was in the file to indicate the
employees were prohibited from transporting youth until a valid license was
received.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance with all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a MDHHS Contract/Policy violation. Please
note that there are additional MDHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance with all additional MDHHS
Contract/Policy requirements.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility did not require technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
A conversation occurred with administration about the challenges statewide regarding
the hiring of direct care staff. While the facility reports being fully staffed, they were
encouraged to continue hiring to develop a pool of qualified staff to fill in as needed
and avoid staffing shortages.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The facility was not required to submit any corrective action plans not related to
4

maltreatment during this licensing period. However, ongoing monitoring of the SIR
2020C0128061 CAP has occurred, as the 1st provisional issuance in December 2020
was due to this SIR. Monthly unannounced visits and CAP reviews have determined
the agency has successfully implemented the CAP and is in compliance with rules
previously cited.
The agency has had three special investigations opened during this reporting period.
Two of them were completed and the facility was found to be in full compliance. The
third one is still being investigated.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the facility will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
